content:
Paul is a Research Associate at the University of Sheffield, in the Department of Mechanical Engineering. He is also a member of the Dynamics Research Group. His research focuses on combining ideas from machine learning and statistics to improve or best utilise physics-based models in engineering applications, with a particular focus in the field of structural health monitoring.  University of Sheffield  [2019-2021, 2022-2023] Research Associate, Dynamics Research Group, University of Sheffield:
DigiTwin - Digital twins for improved dynamic design
EPSRC Programme Grant, PI: Prof. David Wagg, Sheffield PI: Prof. Keith Worden

 [2021-2022] Teaching and Research Fellow (One-year Secondment), Mechanical Engineering, University of Sheffield

 [2015-2019] PhD in Mechanical Engineering, University of Sheffield:
On novel approaches to model-based structural health monitoring
Supervisors: Dr Rob Barthorpe, Dr Charles Lord

HBM Prenscia  [2013-2014] Application Engineer/Software Test Engineer, HBM Prenscia (formely HBM nCode)

His research focuses on combining ideas from machine learning and statistics to improve or best utilise physics-based models in engineering applications, with a particular focus in the field of structural health monitoring.

content:
Engineering Transfer Learning Collection of transfer learning algorithms that have been generated or applied in engineering contexts, particularly for structural health monitoring, avaliable via Github.
Currently models include:
 Transfer component analysis Joint distribution adaptation Balanced distribution adaptation Metric-informed joint distribution adaptation Kernelised Bayesian transfer learning
summary:
